result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan E Belman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Release for standard conditions.
*May terminate at 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety (ONLY IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE AGENT). No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No Violent contact with: victims/witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.  Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
16CM990 is dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  STAYED - for the agent's use.

defendant.name: Belman, Evan E

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Evan E Belman in court with attorney Anthony J Procaccio.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  16CM990 is dismissed and read into this case.  State is in compliance with victim/witness notification. 
State makes recommendations regarding sentencing.  Attorney Procaccio presents statements to the Court.  Attorney Procaccio is requesting expunction.  Defendant makes statements to the Court.  


The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
45 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS STAYED  


Term of Probation: 1 Year  ** May terminate at 6 months if deemed appropriate by the agent **

Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No VIOLENT contact with victims/witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;  ONLY IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE AGENT
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  

Condition time 15 Days Huber STAYED for the agent's use.

COSTS:  $343.00   to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 


Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Evan E Belman in court with Attorney Katherine Graber for Attorney Anthony J Procaccio.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Graber requests an adjournment on behalf of Attorney Procaccio.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Evan E Belman in court with Attorney Anthony J Procaccio.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Scaife withdraws motion and requests a plea and sentence date.  Court allows withdrawal of motion.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on June 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Evan E Belman in court with Attorney Anthony Procaccio.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Procaccio requests an adjournment.  Court sets date also for motion to dismiss.       Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Motion to dismiss criminal complaint. Filed by Atty Procaccio.
Hearing on May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Evan E Belman in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin for Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requests new counsel.  Court grants request - public defender will appoint new counsel in place of Attorney Jorge Fragoso.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on April 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Evan E Belman in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso states that Defendant is requesting a new attorney -  will hire private counsel. Attorney Fragoso requests to withdraw as counsel.  Court adjourns case to see if Defendant retains counsel.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing at 03-03-2016 02:30 pm
Hearing at 02-18-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Evan E Belman in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso requests one more adjournment as he just received discovery.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing at 01-08-2016 10:30 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no contact with Bradley H. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Evan E Belman in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
